items.title: Repository bootstrapped
items.notes: Root docs and manifests establish the ShieldCraft-AI workspace, dependency graph, and build tooling.

evidence.detail: Project overview spells out platform goals, architecture pillars, and contribution model.
Node/Docusaurus tooling pinned for dashboard + docs builds, confirming repo scaffolding.

items.title: Documentation baseline created
items.notes: Docs-site contains the styled checklist and supporting reference material referenced throughout the repo.

evidence.detail: Published implementation tracker mirrors the root checklist with 85% progress.
Docs theme, navigation, and metadata are wired for the GuardSuite/ShieldCraft narratives.

items.title: Initial infra + config wiring
items.notes: Typed config schema plus CDK app composition cover networking, data, security, and tagging baselines.

evidence.detail: CDK entrypoint composes networking, secrets, Glue, MSK, Lambda, and budget stacks per environment.
Singleton config loader enforces backend selection, schema validation, and secret indirection.

items.title: Docs-site scaffold
items.notes: Docusaurus pages, theme config, and landing routes exist, giving the dashboard a stable publishing surface.

evidence.detail: Homepage surfaces GuardSuite CTAs plus static dashboard entry points.
Global metadata, navbar links, and footer entries wire GuardSuite routes.

items.title: Core application structure
items.notes: Static dashboard routes and the demo FastAPI surface illustrate the vertical slice referenced in the checklist.

evidence.detail: Dashboard shell lays out metadata panel plus summary component.
FastAPI demo endpoints expose the vertical-slice payload used in docs.

items.title: Config schema + validator
items.notes: Pydantic schema plus extensive unit coverage validate configuration inputs across backends.

evidence.detail: Schema defines every section (networking, lambda, lakeformation, etc.) with validation hooks.
Pytest suite covers thread safety, backend selection, env overrides, and strict mode errors.

items.title: Initial UI scaffolding
items.notes: Dashboard routes render within the shared layout and include deterministic metadata blocks.

evidence.detail: Route composes Layout + metadata hero + DashboardSummary component.

items.title: Analyst Dashboard (static surface)
items.notes: Static cards show risk, retrieval, and drift evidence directly from docs artifacts with Jest coverage.

evidence.detail: Summary sections render deterministic cards backed by docs references.
Jest test asserts each summary section renders the expected copy.

items.title: Analyst Dashboard (data model + evidence ingest)
items.notes: Evidence feed placeholder mirrors the ingestion envelope and is validated by tests.

evidence.detail: Static JSON payload demonstrates the future evidence envelope and priority badges.
Ensures the evidence feed route renders the placeholder items.

items.title: Analyst Dashboard (finalized UX + charts)
items.notes: DashboardSummary still renders text cards only; none of the chart dependencies declared in package.json are used, and no chart components exist.

evidence.detail: Component only lays out flexbox cards with copy/pillsâ€”no chart primitives or data viz.
chart.js and react-chartjs-2 are installed but unused, underscoring the missing UX polish.

items.title: Public API surface for dashboard
items.notes: The only API file exposes demo endpoints (`/demo-vertical-slice` and `/evaluate`) and nothing serves the dashboard evidence feed.

evidence.detail: FastAPI app returns canned payloads via scripts/demo_vertical_slice.py and has no dashboard routes.
Fetch helper exists but is not wired to any publicly documented dashboard API.

items.title: Authentication model
items.notes: Minimal IdP helper only mocks PKCE flows client-side; there is no server-side auth or token validation backing a public API.

evidence.detail: Utility stores tokens locally and prints debug info but never calls a ShieldCraft backend.
Endpoints accept arbitrary `findingId` without any auth guard or token verification.

items.title: Evidence/query pipeline
items.notes: Evidence feed still pulls from a hard-coded array and there is no ingestion path or query contract that feeds the dashboard.

evidence.detail: Uses a static `evidenceItems` array rather than calling an API.
Demo script emits JSON locally but is not orchestrated into a service or queue feeding the UI.

items.title: GuardSuite documentation foundation
items.notes: GuardSuite index plus core MDX pages (VectorScan overview, blueprints, CLI guide) are authored and linked into the sidebar.

evidence.detail: Index lists each required doc and ties them back to marketing routes.
Explains install, outputs, and upgrade hooks for the free CLI.

items.title: Full GuardSuite docs parity
items.notes: Bundle playbook is stubbed with a TODO block, so the funnel and pricing exhibits called for in the spec are not delivered yet.

evidence.detail: File ends with '**TODO:** Add full bundle comparison tables...' indicating missing parity content.
Product page references bundle funnels, showing the docs dependency that still lacks full depth.

items.title: GuardSuite CLI contract integration
items.notes: Docs describe CLI usage but the repo only ships a placeholder CLI shim; there is no implemented GuardSuite CLI contract.

evidence.detail: Stub CLI simply returns 0 and prints a version, highlighting the lack of real commands.
Guide promises CI snippets for `vectorscan`/`vectorguard` but no corresponding binaries exist in repo.

items.title: GuardSuite model governance integration
items.notes: AI core contains a generic model loader with stub fallback, but nothing ties GuardSuite policy packs or approvals into the model lifecycle.

evidence.detail: Implements HuggingFace/stub switching with no GuardSuite governance hooks.
Pgvector scaffold exists but is not wired into GuardSuite promotion or approval flows.

items.title: CDK baseline
items.notes: Environment-aware CDK app plus typed config deliver the baseline infrastructure stack referenced by the checklist.

evidence.detail: Instantiates networking, data, security, compliance, and budget stacks with tagging.
Configuration enumerates every stack input (VPC, MSK, LakeFormation, Lambda, etc.).

items.title: Multi-region failover rehearsal
items.notes: Infra TODO explicitly calls this out as unchecked work; there are no scripts or tests simulating cross-region failover.

evidence.detail: P0 checklist still lists 'Multi-region failover rehearsal' as unchecked.

items.title: SBOM generation pipeline
items.notes: No SBOM tooling appears under scripts or CI, and the infra TODO plus prior repo scans flag this gap.

evidence.detail: 'SBOM generation pipeline' remains unchecked in the infra roadmap.
Previous audit reiterates that no SBOM generation/signing pipeline exists.

items.title: IAM automated access-review cadence
items.notes: Neither scripts nor docs define an automated IAM review job; the TODO list still lists this requirement as open.

evidence.detail: Item 'IAM automated access-review cadence' is still unchecked.

items.title: Multi-agent orchestration core
items.notes: AI core only offers a single-model loader and vector store; no orchestrator or agent graph exists.

evidence.detail: Implements single-model loading without any agent coordination.
Package exposes only loader/vector store scaffolds.

items.title: Prompt-governance registry
items.notes: No prompt registry or governance catalog is present; AI modules focus solely on loading models and pgvector scaffolding.

evidence.detail: Contains model selection logic but no prompt governance definitions.

items.title: Approval workflow + safety rail
items.notes: Docs and code lack any approval workflow, safety rail enforcement, or GuardScore-aware gating for AI responses.

evidence.detail: Returns raw generations or stub echoes without approval or policy checks.
ML guardrails section references manual follow-up, underscoring the absence of automated approval rails.

items.title: Continuous relevance drift monitoring
items.notes: Dashboard references drift reports stored in docs, but there is no automated monitoring loop or service emitting alerts.

evidence.detail: Drift section pulls static text referencing docs rather than live drift metrics.
Documentation explains the dashboard relies on manual markdown updates for drift snapshots.
